an5.132:4.1: “Mendicants, possessing five factors a wheel-turning monarch’s oldest son continues to wield the power set in motion by his father only in a principled manner.
an5.132:4.2: And this power cannot be undermined by any human enemy.
an5.132:5.2: A wheel-turning monarch’s eldest son knows what is right, knows principle, knows moderation, knows the right time, and knows the assembly.
an5.132:5.3: A wheel-turning monarch’s oldest son who possesses these five factors continues to wield the power set in motion by his father only in a principled manner.
an5.132:5.4: And this power cannot be undermined by any human enemy.
an5.132:6.1: In the same way, possessing five factors Sāriputta rightly keeps rolling the supreme Wheel of Dharma that was rolled forth by the Realized One.
an5.132:6.2: And that wheel cannot be turned back by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.
an5.132:7.2: Sāriputta knows what is right, knows principle, knows moderation, knows the right time, and knows the assembly.
an5.132:7.3: Possessing these five factors Sāriputta rightly keeps rolling the supreme Wheel of Dharma that was rolled forth by the Realized One.
an5.132:7.4: And that wheel cannot be turned back by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.”
